metadata.Title: CVE-2021-4037 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: A vulnerability was found in the fs/inode.c:inode_init_owner() functionlogic of the LInux kernel that allows local users to create files for theXFS file-system with an unintended group ownership and with group executionand SGID permission bits set, in a scenario where a directory is SGID andbelongs to a certain group and is writable by a user who is not a member ofthis group. This can lead to excessive permissions granted in case whenthey should not. This vulnerability is similar to the previousCVE-2018-13405 and adds the missed fix for the XFS.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
